wikipedia_page.main: Duncan Ashley Paveling (born 8 June 1977) is an English screenwriter known for the independent film My Feral Heart as well as a cricketer active at the higher levels in the early 2000s.  Paveling served as a right-handed batsman who played primarily as a wicketkeeper in his List A matches.  He was born in Bristol.

response: She has also appeared in such productions as Easter 2016 in the Play for Tomorrow series (1982), After You've Gone (1984), Far and Away (1992), and Wild About Harry, in 2000. She appeared in the film version of Frank McCourt's book, Angela's Ashes, and played "Molly", the landlady in Far and Away (1992) with Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman, director Ron Howard. In 2010 she played Miss Kessler in Reg Traviss's Psychosis, and in 2016 she played the mother of a child with Down's syndrome in Duncan Paveling's My Feral Heart.

response: My Feral Heart is a 2016 British independent film written by Duncan Paveling and directed by Jane Gull.  It charts the story of Luke, an independent young man with Down syndrome, forced in to a residential home following the death of his mother. Luke slowly builds relationships and goes on to demonstrate his abilities in a touching story.
